content:
Hello!
Please help me, step by step, to install my own zulip server on Ubuntu 16.04.5 LTS. I registered a domain name, I registered my server's IPv4 address in A-record. I deleted AAAA-record. Nslookup domain name returns the correct address. Firewall turned off. Ports are open. During the installation with the --cerbot switch, an error of an incorrect answer from .well-know occurs constantly (To fix these errors, please make sure that your domain name was   A / AAAA record (s) for that domain contain (s) the right IP address.) What could I miss in server pre-configuration? Should I customize the host and hostname files? Please help ) :slight_smile:

@Sergey I would recommend using the --self-signed-cert option to get Zulip installed, and then you can google around for the certbot errors you're seeing separately to debug getting a proper SSL cert (we just call certbot with the options you provide. But certbot has a very popular forum with lots of helpful answers).
